Document.Title: Sun JAXP Tutorial: 1. A Quick Introduction to XML

Content:
* “To complete this journeyman’s introduction to XML, note that an XML file always starts with a prolog… it may contain the following attributes: version… encoding… standalone… The prolog can also contain definitions of entities…”

* “An XML file can also contain processing instructions that give commands or information to an application that is processing the XML data. Processing instructions have the following format: <?target instructions?>”
